misc: The phenomenon called 'Okkotoberfest' was named after his alcohol-induced condition in a past Hector event
biography: Okko, a familiar face from Hirsala Golf, is gearing up for his fifth appearance at the Hector Trophée in 2025. A competitor known for his strategic play and steely determination, Okko has secured the coveted Hector Trophée once in his past four attempts, proving his mettle in this challenging pairs competition.
While he is yet to claim the Victor Trophy, which is awarded to the best individual player, his consistent performance underscores his commitment to the sport.

Those who have watched Okko closely might know about the challenges that he has faced with recurring back problems. However, his resilience and dedication to golf are evident in his continued participation in the Hector Trophée.

Okko is perhaps best known for an incident at a past Hector event, in which he allegedly enjoyed the post-competition festivities a little too much. The incident spawned a now-legendary phenomenon known as 'Okkotoberfest', synonymous with spirited celebrations. While he is known to take his golf seriously, Okko enjoys being a personality on and off the course.
